name: Outer Shoals
role_in_state: Maritime hazard buffer and specialty reagent harvester
culture_adjustments: Stronger shoal-superstitions; rites keyed to low-tide windows
Dialect preserves archaic Coastal Tongues forms + heavier Island Creole loanwords
Local authority vested in lighthouse-keepers and saltmasters
Economy and social life centered on salvage/local barter over long-range trade
Festival calendar emphasizes storm-watch and tidal clearances
constraints: Very limited arable land; reliant on food imports
Shallow waters restrict large-ship yards and heavy industry
Seasonal access windows for larger vessels
Ritual magic dependent on scarce imported reagents
notes: Key supplier of kelp-based ritual reagents used statewide
Natural lighthouses are hereditary offices with civic powers
Serves as early-warning belt for storms and approaching fleets
